description: The best idea in the world is worthless without great execution. Delivering great software products in teams requires rallying people behind an idea, strong technical leadership throughout the project, a focus on quality, and excellent communication to keep everyone aligned.

signals: Understands their team's practices and processes
Understands basic utility of the product
Understands the importance of weighing cost and value in decision making
examples: Asks more senior engineers for help in applying this type of thinking to their work

signals: Understands priority and urgency and delivers upon them accordingly
examples: Escalates any blockers or delays to the team

signals: Understands business drivers and strategic needs for features and is able to analyse, understand and satisfy constraints in the context of the business' vertical
Collaborates with PMs and business stakeholders to define product directions, technology directions, budget trends and resourcing needs
Able to evaluate effort, risks and dependencies of tasks
Pragmatism, enables a culture focused on pragmatic solutions
Able to decrypt unclear stakeholder requirements and drives for clarity to ensure right problem is addressed
examples: Continuously improves agile product delivery methods in the team
Participates in interview process for other engineers
Takes end to end ownership of the development and operation of complete features

signals: Strives for simplification of systems and processes to ensure fast and reliable delivery of our products
Proactivley discusses with PM and business stakeholders to define directions, technolegy to improve budget and resorcing needs
Implements and ensures best countious improving practices like RCAs faciliation and retrospectives
Takes ownership and responsibility for organizational practices and processes and their continuous improvement

examples: You lead e2e migration to new tech stacks/service and you become an expert in that field while doing so
You solve problems that spanns across tribes (deployment ci/cd for example, performance issues)
